full_description:
SaaStock was founded by Alexa Theuma on a simple belief: 

When the SaaS community comes together, the result is collective improvement.

That’s why SaaStock events connect key players in the world of SaaS, by serving as a platform for learning, networking, demos, and investments. 

The premier 3-day SaaStock conference occurs annually in Dublin, Ireland. It attracts 3000+ attendees, all in the business of growing and scaling B2B SaaS companies.

The conference includes satellite events such as: 

1. SaaS.City - A series of SaaS management bootcamps. 

2. InvestStock - An investor-only, content and networking event. 

3. Startup Programme - An opportunity for startups to showcase products, connect with investors, and accelerate their growth. 

4. Global Pitch Competition - A hunt to find the year’s “Best SaaS Startup” with a $25,000 grand prize.

SaaStock also hosts 1-day, SaaStock On Tour events in locations including Paris, London, Sydney, Helsinki, Berlin, and New York.

full_description:
We are enterprise software experts.  We look to co-invest with strong leads, bringing our network of coinvestors and next round investors as well as enterprise software expertise to add value.  We see ourselves as partners who can fill out a round quickly and be a positive influence, and non-competitive as we don't lead or take significant stakes in our portfolio companies.  We generally write a small check into rounds of $750k-$3M that are mostly full, being low pain-in-the-ass to entrepreneurs compared to relatively high value add.  Having been entrepreneurs, we know that's the most important part.

While we'll invest anywhere in the US, we love "second tier markets" that can still support major exits but attract relatively less venture funding: Chicago, Toronto, DC, Baltimore, Atlanta, etc etc!
address: Miami, Florida, United States, North America

full_description:
The Artificial Intelligence Foundation, generously funded by the Odegard Foundation, is a visionary non-profit initiative committed to steering the transformative power of artificial intelligence (AI) towards the greater good of humanity. At the heart of its mission, the Foundation is dedicated to fostering awareness, guiding ethical implementation, advocating for responsible development, and establishing rigorous standards in the field of AI. Through the support of the Odegard Foundation, the Artificial Intelligence Foundation is uniquely positioned to make a significant impact on how AI technologies are developed and integrated into society.

Awareness: Central to the Foundation's efforts is the drive to increase public and institutional awareness about the potential and challenges of AI. Through a variety of educational programs, including public lectures, workshops, and digital content, the Foundation aims to build a well-informed community ready to engage with AI technologies critically and constructively. These efforts help demystify AI, making it more accessible and understandable to diverse audiences across the globe.

Implementation: Leveraging the financial backing and network of the Odegard Foundation, the Artificial Intelligence Foundation works collaboratively with partners across sectors to implement AI solutions that address key societal challenges. From healthcare and education to environmental sustainability, the Foundation brings AI to the forefront of social innovation, ensuring that its benefits are broadly distributed and aligned with public interest.

Ethics: Ethics stands as a pillar of the Foundation's philosophy. In the rapidly evolving landscape of AI, the initiative champions the development and adoption of ethical guidelines that govern the creation and use of AI. By emphasizing principles such as fairness, accountability, transparency, and privacy, the Foundation seeks to ensure that AI advancements respect human rights and dignity.

Development: The Foundation also actively supports the cutting-edge development of AI technologies. With funding from the Odegard Foundation, it invests in research and innovation aimed at pushing the boundaries of what AI can achieve. The initiative fosters a collaborative environment where scientists, developers, and ethicists can come together to create AI solutions that are not only technologically advanced but also socially responsible and ethically grounded.

Standards: Recognizing the need for global cooperation in the age of AI, the Artificial Intelligence Foundation leads the way in establishing standards for AI development, deployment, and interoperability. These standards are crucial for ensuring that AI technologies are reliable, safe, and beneficial across different contexts and industries. By setting these benchmarks, the Foundation contributes to a sustainable and harmonious AI future.

In essence, the Artificial Intelligence Foundation, with the pivotal support of the Odegard Foundation, is shaping a future where AI serves as a force for positive change. By balancing the scales between technological innovation and social responsibility, the Foundation not only envisions a world enhanced by AI but actively works towards creating it, ensuring that the benefits of AI are shared equitably and ethically across society.
address: Zürich, Zurich, Switzerland, Europe

about: Piston is the OpenStack® orchestration company.

featured_list.title: Closed West Coast Software Companies

full_description:
Founded in 2011, Piston makes Piston OpenStack™, a software product that automates the orchestration of an entire private cloud environment on commodity servers. Companies building web, mobile, and big data applications use Piston’s secure and cost-effective AWS-like capabilities to bring new products to market faster. By managing a group of servers as a single pool of elastic and scalable computing resources, Piston OpenStack improves datacenter efficiency thereby accelerating the application development process.

Created by several of the founders of OpenStack, Piston drives the OpenStack project forward via code contributions, thought leadership through the OpenStack Project Policy Board, and in support of the OpenStack developer community. We willingly share our expertise, leadership, guidance, vision and code with the community and the other companies working to make OpenStack the industry standard in cloud.

The company is headquartered in San Francisco and funded by True Ventures, Hummer Winblad, Swisscom Ventures, Cisco Systems, Inc., Data Collective, and Divergent Ventures.
address: San Francisco, California, United States, North America

full_description:
Artificial Intelligence Expert is a biomedical data science company. They use artificial intelligence to discover robust omics biomarkers. The company's universal AI platform extracts highly accurate predictive models from omics data, for diagnosis, prognosis, and response to treatment.
Product description: 
1. i-Biomarker is an AI-driven platform for complex Biomedical data processing, analysis, and modeling. It can ingest all kinds of raw data (omics, signals, images, text, clinical, pathological, etc.) and produces models (tests) for diagnosis, prognosis, response to treatment monitoring, and prediction. It uses Explainable AI (XAI), Functional Analysis, and Network Pharmacology to explain the predicted biomedical outcomes at the population and personalized level, in terms of molecular mechanisms, and for personalized treatment recommendations. It can develop digital twins for both patients and physicians.

full_description:
The Cloud Computing Caucus Advisory Group is a non-profit, non-partisan coalition of technology companies and industry groups focused on educating lawmakers and the public about cloud computing as well as other information technology issues.

The Cloud Computing Caucus Advisory Group is driven by the understanding that sound policy relies on a full understanding of the issues affecting Federal information technology.
